New Records: Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 20 points and seven rebounds in the game.
Memphis Grizzlies led by as many as 45 points during the game.
Key Match Events: Edey boxed out Clingan and made a key play leading to a three-pointer by Scotty Pippen Jr.
The Blazers struggled with shooting, finishing 17 of 49 from the floor and 1 of 18 from three-point range.
Pre-Game Insights: Memphis Grizzlies were leading the league in points in the paint with 60.8 points, and they scored 58 against the Blazers.
Post-Match Reflections: The Blazers held a moment of silence for former broadcaster Brian Wheeler before the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the first meeting between Edey and Clingan since their NCAA championship game.
Memphis' 5-foot-8 rookie Yuki Kawamura made his debut in the fourth quarter.
Others: The Grizzlies won five of their last six games before this match.
